publisher.publisher-name: Military Operations Research Society in cooperation with the Military Applications Society (MAS) of the Institute for Operations Research and Management Science (INFORMS)

title-group.article-title: March 2007 Air Force Institute of Technology MORS Graduate Research Award
title-group.subtitle: A Layered Social and Operational Network Analysis

bio.p: Captain Jennifer L. Geffre received a BS in Mathematics with an Emphasis in Secondary Education at Colorado State University, December 1998. She has recently received an MS in Operations Research, Information Operations/Decision Analysis.

Before going to AFIT to receive her MS she was an Information Operations/Electronic Warfare Systems Analyst with the 453rd EWS/EWA, Lackland AFB, TX. She provided EW and IO analyses essential to joint and coalition combat mission planning and post-mission review. She completed quick turn-around EW/Communications/PSYOP analyses in support of SECAF and multiple AORs Capt Geffre produced tailored near-real time and real time analyses for ISR collections optimization in support of Operations Enduring Freedom and Iraqi Freedom. She conducted fused multi-intelligence analyses of improvised explosive device (IED) events, which improved suspect search and IED situational awareness.
